content:
Diagnosis:	Left breast cancer UOQ 9mm Grade 2 invasive ductal carcinoma completely excised 0/2 nodes ER 8 PR 7 HER2 negative

Rx:		Left WLE + SLNB 15/01/2024
RT to Left Breast 40Gy/15# (Dr [redacted name]) RT completed February 2024
Letrozole commenced March 2024, on calcium/vitamin D supplementation
	
DEXA scan 20/02/2024 T-score -1.4 hip, -1.1 spine

Seen by breast surgeon 1 week ago for left breast fluid collection
US March 2024 Left Breast u2: post-operative changes only
Demonstrates small seroma measuring 1.8 x 1.2 cm in surgical bed within left upper outer quadrant. No suspicious features.
Normal left axilla. No concerning masses or lymphadenopathy.
Mammogram postponed due to recent surgery and known iodine sensitivity.
Patient agrees to ultrasound follow-up protocol.

Discussion regarding bone health monitoring today

general condition good
On Letrozole: mild arthralgia, occasional hot flushes, tolerating well overall
fatigue improved with regular exercise regime
known rheumatoid arthritis

part-time piano instructor

Patient asked about bone protection therapy
Reviewed current guidelines - not indicated for bisphosphonate therapy given node negative status, favorable prognostic features, and mild osteopenia only

Plan:
Continue current bone health supplementation
Maintain Letrozole with calcium/vitamin D for intended 5 year course
Repeat DEXA scan December 2024
Scheduling breast ultrasound for October 2024 prior to surgical follow-up November 2024
